title: Ideation
description: Generate and collect innovative ideas from team members and customers
details: Ideas can come from customer feedback, internal brainstorms, competitive analysis, or technical opportunities. Document the problem statement and proposed value.

title: Initial Review
description: Quick assessment of idea feasibility and alignment
details: Review team evaluates strategic fit, technical feasibility, and resource requirements. Ideas are either advanced, sent back for refinement, or archived.

title: Deep Dive Analysis
description: Detailed analysis of requirements, effort, and business case
details: Technical team creates architecture proposal, PM develops business case with ROI projections, and stakeholders are identified.

title: Approval Gateway
details: Leadership reviews business case, technical design, and resource requirements. Approved projects move to roadmap, others are deferred or cancelled.
outcomes: Approve and fund|Defer to future quarter|Cancel

title: Roadmap Planning
description: Schedule project into quarterly roadmap with milestones
details: PM and engineering leads define milestones, dependencies, and delivery timeline. Project is communicated to broader team.

title: Implementation
details: Agile development process with sprint planning, daily standups, code reviews, and testing. Regular demos to stakeholders ensure alignment.

title: Release & Launch
description: Deploy to production and communicate to customers
details: Feature is deployed, release notes are published, customer success is trained, and marketing materials are prepared.

title: Measurement & Feedback
description: Track adoption metrics and gather customer feedback
details: Monitor usage analytics, collect customer feedback, measure against success metrics defined in business case. Insights feed into future innovation cycle.
